title: [Large-Scale] Project-Based Mathematical Instructional Design for Patient Access Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical terminology, comprehension of instructional design theories, and familiarity with fundamental statistics/probability concepts
context.additional_context: For pre-service/in-service teachers, cultivating instructional design skills that integrate Gagné’s Nine Events of Instruction with mathematical analysis techniques for patient-centered education

learning_goals: Learners will design patient approach education modules by integrating Gagné’s 9 events of instruction with mathematical modeling techniques.
In small-group projects, learners will develop educational scenarios analyzing statistical variables in patient safety protocols (e.g., patient identification, specimen receipt).
When designing formative assessments, learners will apply probability/statistics techniques to quantitatively measure educational effectiveness.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
